article.title: Queueing Analysis for Block Fading Rayleigh Channels in the Low SNR Regime

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the figure depict regarding the average packet delay (E[D]) in the infinite-buffer model?
choices: E[D] decreases linearly with increasing θ.
E[D] remains constant regardless of θ.
E[D] increases exponentially with increasing θ.
E[D] shows a logarithmic increase with increasing θ.

multiple_choice_question.text: How does the average vestige time (E[V]) behave with increasing θ?
choices: E[V] remains below 0.5 and increases with θ.
E[V] exceeds 0.5 and increases linearly with θ.
E[V] stays constant regardless of θ.
E[V] decreases exponentially with increasing θ.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the relationship between the stationary queue length distribution and the parameter θ?
choices: Higher θ leads to a faster decrease in the probability of longer queue lengths.
The queue length distribution remains unaffected by changes in θ.
Lower θ leads to a slower decrease in the probability of longer queue lengths.
The probability of longer queue lengths increases linearly with θ.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Formula (4) represent in the context of the paper?
choices: Probability of a packet being served within a single block
Probability generating function (PGF) of the stationary queue length at departure epochs
Average packet delay in the infinite-buffer model
Stationary queue length distribution at arbitrary epochs
